National Geographic photographer / based in Slovenia / Leica Camera / currently in Greenland

posts.description:
On my way back to Northern Greenland for few weeks. Can't wait to explore new places in this amazing country. This time I am going to Qaanaaq - the extreme north of Greenland. 
@natgeo #Greenland #Arctic #seaice #north #journey

‚ÄúHurry up, I‚Äôm late.‚Äù A girl sits on a boda boda that‚Äôs negotiating the rush hour in Kampala, Uganda, where I‚Äôve started work on a story called rising Africa. I‚Äôm currently in Rwanda on an assignment for @natgeo. #rising #Africa #onassignment #bodaboda

Sunny weekend at home ends... Now I'm already on a way to Rwanda for a @natgeo assignment. Very excited to explore a 'country of a thousand hills' for the first time. Stay tuned. #family #portrait #studio
Testing Leica M10 for the first time and falling in love. üì∑‚≠êÔ∏è #LeicaM10 #night #street #portrait #Leica @leica_camera

I met Dragan Stamenov, born in 1959, over coffee in the town of Kratovo. He has been unemployed since 1993, when the sandpaper factory closed down. Since his wife died, he lives alone and has no children. #Macedonia #Kratovo #portrait

The Zastava 750 is a motif frequently encountered in the countries of former Yugoslavia. It is widely known by its nickname ‚ÄúFiƒáo‚Äù or "Fiƒáa" in Serbian, Croatian and Bosnian, ‚ÄúFiƒço‚Äù or ‚ÄúFiƒçko‚Äù in Slovene, and ‚ÄúFikjo‚Äù in Macedonia. In the village of ≈†hlegovo, I noticed one in a deserted street where I felt as if I had stepped into the past. Fiƒço was created by Fiat soon after World War II. It was first presented at the 1955 Geneva Motor Show, where it was hailed as the ‚Äúeconomic miracle‚Äù of post-war Italy. These cars were not only popular and widespread among the people throughout Yugoslavia, they were also used by the police, by emergency services, the army and driving schools, and they competed in races. Nowadays, they can still be seen on the roads of former Yugoslav republics; a couple still exist in Slovenia as well. #zastava750 #fico

I'm always surprised by the sudden burst of energy that I get with each of my trips. I may be feeling uninspired, but then an encounter with a random local suddenly nudges me towards a special kind of flow. I‚Äôm so grateful to be able to do what I do, learning the stories of people in places previously unknown to me. We met Ljubica Spasovska on a random Kratovo street. Ljubica has three children and three grandchildren. One of her sons lives in New Jersey, where Ljubica had visited him with her husband four years ago. She has spent all her life toiling the fields and working for a better tomorrow. We wished her to remain as healthy and strong as she was when we met her. #Macedonia #Kratovo #journey #portrait #staystrong

Kratovo is a small picturesque town, one of the regions' living museums in Republic of Macedonia. It lies on the western slopes of Mount Osogovo at an altitude of 600 metres (2,000 ft) above sea level. Having a mild and pleasant climate, it is located in the crater of an extinct volcano. It is famous for its bridges and towers. #Macedonia #Kratovo #landscape #Osogovo #mountain #journey

Meet Dimitar, 67, a farmer from the village of Shlegovo in Macedonia. We met him by chance while he was doing some work around his farm. He said, ‚ÄúLet me show you the groom.‚Äù Seconds later he brought out a beautiful buck goat. Dimitar invited us into his house and offered us home-made rakija. He told us his life story, how he got married at 18 and had 3 daughters and 6 grandchildren. They all live in Skopje, the Macedonian capital, but he still lives in his village. He had worked for 22 years as a glass etcher at the Crystal glass factory, however, the factory closed right after the break-up of Yugoslavia. #Macedonia #Shlegovo #onassignment #portrait

These days I‚Äôve been exploring Republic of Macedonia, and with each day I‚Äôve been more impressed by the amazing landscape. This morning, we drove along the Vardar River and stopped at a spot overlooking a railway station. #Macedonia #landscape #onassignment #travel

The frozen Lake Bled drew quite a crowd last week. Girls from the Labod Bled ice-skating club surprised passers-by with a performance on ice. Although temperatures were below 0¬∞C, the plucky girls faced down the cold with high spirits. #Bled #frozen #lake #Slovenia #igslovenia

Lake Bled freezing has been a very rare occurrence in the past few decades. It had last happened in 2012 and 2005. The phenomenon is so rare that one mustn‚Äôt miss it. Just think ‚Äì it took as much as two months of cold for the lake to freeze over. 
In the winters of the 1960s and 70s, Lake Bled was a genuine icy paradise. People flocked to it in droves to play hockey and skate, to ride sleds or walk to the island in the middle of the lake. The frozen lake even hosted motorcycle races.

This was taken a week ago and unfortunately due to higher temperature the ice is no longer safe. #Bled #lake #island #frozen #Slovenia #ice #igslovenia
Izak and Ajda. Late afternoon light & Leica M magic. #family #moment #portrait @ajduush @leica_camera

Finally found out how to get best nine out of my IG account. What a crazy year was 2016. My son was born and assignments took me to magical places like Greenland, Bhutan and Kenya. Thanks everyone for a great support. I wish you all at least one great adventure in 2017! ‚≠êÔ∏è

Magic of the Postojna cave underground caught in the White Hall ‚Äì one of the famous halls of this 24,1 km long Slovenian karst underground wonder, home of ¬ªbaby dragons¬´ and magnificent formations, craddle of speleobiology and the hotspot of subterranean biodiversity. @postojnacave #PostojnaCave #Postojna  #Slovenia #igslovenia#performance #underworld #cave #karst

Every October, for the past few years, Milan Kastelic, a local of Postojna starts growing his beard. This is only to meet the criteria of becoming a perfomer in the respected 5-day Living Nativity performance in the famous @postojnacave. After the performance, the beard must go, as Mrs Kastelic does not approve. 
#Postojna cave #Slovenia #nativity #igslovenia#performance #underworld #cave #portrait #postojnacave

Singer Teja Saksida  just moments away from her first performance of the day in the Living Nativity performance @postojnacave. A tradition, going back to 1989 is held every holiday season. She is just one of about 150 performers ‚Äì mostly locals, who  gather here every day for 5 days. This cave, which has been forming for millions of years, out of sight, but right under their feet has been part of their community for centuries. A special story in a special place which brings together special people. This is just one part of their magic. #Postojnacave #Slovenia #living #nativity #performance #cave
